title: Identify What We Are Looking For
text: We are looking for the cost of a package of paper. We also do not know the cost of a stapler.

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: $$3$$ packages of paper and $$4$$ staplers cost $40: $$3p+4s=40$$.
speech: 3  packages of paper and  4  staplers cost $40:  3 p plus 4 s is equal to 40 .
pacedSpeech: staplers cost $40:   3 p plus 4 s is equal to 40

title: Translate into a System of Equations
text: $$5$$ packages of paper and $$6$$ staplers cost $62: $$5n+6m=62$$.
speech: 5  packages of paper and  6  staplers cost $62:  5 n plus 6 m is equal to 62 .
pacedSpeech: staplers cost $62:   5 n plus 6 m is equal to 62

title: Solve the System of Equations
text: To solve the system of equations, use elimination. The equations are in standard form. To get opposite coefficients of s, multiply the first equation by $$-3$$ and the second equation by $$2$$.\n(3*p+4*s=40)*-3\n(5*n+6*m=62)*2

title: Eliminate a Variable
speech: Add the two equations.\n minus 9 p minus 12 s is equal to negative 120 \n 10 p plus 12 s is equal to 124
